DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Re-excision First Cancer Progression Unknown Performed Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field related to not knowing about the surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt following the initial increase in the size of a tumor or spread of cancer in the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Re-excision First Cancer Progression Unknown Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to not knowing about the surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt following the initial increase in the size of a tumor or spread of cancer in the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredName: Re-excision First Cancer Progression Unknown Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:The worsening of a cancer over time.:Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free-text field related to treatment or therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
